result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Examination under 971.16 - Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 9/16/22.

11:08 AM Defendant Christopher C Salimes in court.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Christopher C Salimes.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review.

Defense moves to enter a special plea of NGI and requests an NGI Evaluation under 971.16 be ordered.  Court Grants and order an NGI Evaluation under 971.16.  Court will Appoint Behavioral Consultants.  Evaluation to be filed by 11/11/22.
Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Review hearing on November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Christopher C Salimes in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Bradley Meyer, of the Town of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Hirt.
Cross examination by attorney Kees.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
01:27 PM Defendant Christopher C Salimes in court, in custody from Mendota, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher C Salimes appeared by video means with Attorney.
Cases called for Review Hearing.
Attorney Kees has reviewed the report filed by Dr. Debor with the client and is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
State is not challenging the doctors report.

The court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to attain competency within statutory limits.  
The Court, upon making the finding, suspends the criminal proceedings.


  Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 8, 2022.  Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
filed by Dr. Thomas DeBoer.
AMENDED Order for Competency Examination signed by Judge Jennifer Dorow on 5/4/22.
Proposed Amended Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Review hearing on May 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:48 AM Defendant Christopher C Salimes in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address warrant issued. 
Court quashes the warrant. 
  
Court vacates commitment order previously ordered and orders a Competency Evaluation under 971.14. 

Court orders an In-patient (In-custody) competency evaluation. Evaluation to be filed by 5/15/22 at noon. 
Defendant will be held without bail pending evaluation. 
Upon his evaluation and the report being filed with the court, the court will address bond.
Court will amend the order in 22CF728 to an In-patient (In-custody) evaluation.  
  Review hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

**Upon further review of the Court and to be as clear as possible, the Court orders bond in 20CF780 revoked, and the bond set in 22CF728 vacated. Upon completion of the evaluation and notification to the Court of the same, the Court will address bond in both cases.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Anna Kees.
Hearing on May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Order for Competency Examination signed by CC Herring
Competency Examination to be signed by CC Herring

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS by close of business on 05/04/2022.

02:28 PM Defendant Christopher C Salimes in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Kees would like to be heard regarding probable cause as to Count 1 and makes arguments.  The State responds to the arguments made by Attorney Kees.  For the reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny the motion.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter as soon as possible to tag along with the defendant's other felony matter thas is currently in warrant status.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
